notes.text:
Security researchers discovered and disclosed 9 vulnerabilities in several DNS implementations, also known as “NAME:WRECK” vulnerabilities. The vulnerabilities described in this advisory are from this set.

The DNS client of the networking component (Nucleus NET) in Nucleus Real-Time Operating System (RTOS) contains two out of bounds write vulnerabilities in the handling of DNS responses that could allow an attacker to cause a denial-of-service condition or to remotely execute code.

Siemens has released updates for several affected products and recommends to update to the latest versions. Siemens recommends specific countermeasures for products where updates are not available.
notes.title: Summary

notes.text:
As a general security measure, Siemens strongly recommends to protect network access to devices with appropriate mechanisms. In order to operate the devices in a protected IT environment, Siemens recommends to configure the environment according to Siemens' operational guidelines for Industrial Security (Download: https://www.siemens.com/cert/operational-guidelines-industrial-security), and to follow the recommendations in the product manuals.

Additional information on Industrial Security by Siemens can be found at: https://www.siemens.com/industrialsecurity
notes.title: General Recommendations

notes.text: For further inquiries on security vulnerabilities in Siemens products and solutions, please contact the Siemens ProductCERT: https://www.siemens.com/cert/advisories

notes.text: The DNS domain name label parsing functionality does not properly validate the names in DNS-responses. The parsing of malformed responses could result in a write past the end of an allocated structure. An attacker with a privileged position in the network could leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of the current process or cause a denial-of-service condition.
notes.title: Summary

remediations.details: Update to the latest version of Nucleus ReadyStart V3 or V4
Note that the latest version of Nucleus NET (V5.2) is not affected, but is already beyond end of software support
Contact customer support or your local Nucleus Sales team for mitigation advice
Contact customer support to receive patch and update information
Avoid using DNS client of affected versions

notes.text: The DNS domain name record decompression functionality does not properly validate the pointer offset values. The parsing of malformed responses could result in a write past the end of an allocated structure. An attacker with a privileged position in the network could leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of the current process or cause a denial-of-service condition.
